thread.title: Jamie Carragher trolls Gary Neville AGAIN, as banter battle between the two pundits gets personal
thread.title_full: Jamie Carragher trolls Gary Neville AGAIN, as banter battle between the two pundits gets personal

author: Richard Innes
title: Jamie Carragher trolls Gary Neville AGAIN, as banter battle between the two pundits gets personal
text:
Sport Jamie Carragher trolls Gary Neville AGAIN, as banter battle between the two pundits gets personal The social media war between these two is so entertaining, someone should give them their own TV progra… OH YEAH, THAT'S RIGHT Share CARRA BANTZ (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty Images / Instagram) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Forget Ant and Dec, Morecambe and Wise or The Two Ronnies. 
Jamie Carragher and Gary Neville are fast becoming Britain's finest comedy duo… on social media, at least. Once sworn-enemies-of-north-western-football, the two Sky Sports pundits now regularly engage in 'banter-tastic' (sorry) exchanges that are often more entertaining than some of the matches they analyse. 
Normally, they troll/mock/laugh at each other when Liverpool or Manchester United suffer a setback - like when Carra rubbed salt into the wound after The Red Devils were beaten by Fenerbahce, or when GNev found a particularly cruel way of wishing his 'pal' a happy birthday. Best buds… sort of (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
However, it seems things have now gone up a level. Judging by one of the comments on Neville's latest Instagram post, it appears they have now moved on to outright personal abuse. Here is the post in question - a seemingly innocent picture of GNev getting his hair cut. As with everything Neville posts, there were a lot of comments and responses - most of which were nonsense. But one comment stood out: Yes, that is Neville's colleague - and king of Twitter comedy - making a gag about the size of Neville's nose. Perhaps a tad harsh… but still pretty funny. Further proof, if proof were needed, that we need to see these two men reunited on TV - asap. Make MNF great again! (Photo: Sky Sports/Getty)
